intro: Declieuxia brevicollis, commonly known as the narrow-necked sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, grasses, and rushes. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it forms dense clusters of grass-like foliage. Its leaves are linear and often have a distinct, narrow neck at the base, giving it its common name. Declieuxia brevicollis is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers that develop in spikelets, typical of the sedge family.
